00072 void setup()
00073 {
00074   Serial.begin(19200);
00075   initializeSensor();
00076   discover();
00077 }
00078 
00079 void loop()
00080 {
00081   waitForSampleInterval();
00082   sample();
00083 }
00084 
00085 void sample()
00086 {
00087   getRawData();
00088   convertToTemperature();
00089   sendData();
00090 }

00093 //communications.h
00094 int getByte(int timeout)
00095 {
00096   int currentTime=millis();
00097   int maxTime=currentTime+timeout;
00098   while((Serial.available()==0)&&(millis()<(maxTime)))
00099     {}
00100   if(Serial.available()>0)        //did any data come in on the serial port?
00101     return Serial.read();
00102   else                             //we didn't get any data before the timeout
00103     return -1;
00104 }
00105 
00106 int getMessage(int timeout)
00107 {
00108   int completeMessage=-1;   //a flag that lets us know if we got a full message
00109   start=index;              //drop whatever other data is in our buffer--it'll probably just confuse the functions if we don't
00110   int currentTime=millis();
00111   int maxTime=currentTime+timeout;  
00112   while((millis()<(maxTime))&&(buffer[index]!=MESSAGE_END))
00113     {
00114       if(Serial.available()>0)
00115         {
00116           buffer[index]=Serial.read();
00117           if(buffer[index]==MESSAGE_END)   //we got a complete message
00118             completeMessage=1;
00119           index++;
00120         }
00121     }
00122   if(completeMessage==-1)    //we never got a complete message
00123     start=index;    //skip past whatever we got from the buffer
00124   
00125   return completeMessage;
00126 }
00127 
00129 void sendData()
00130 {
00131   char tries=0;
00132   char success=FALSE;
00133   int response;
00134   while((success==FALSE)&&(tries<NUM_TRIES))
00135   {
00136     sprintf(message, "thermistor 1 = %f degrees C", sensor1_temperature);
00137     unsigned char checksum=getChecksum();
00138     Serial.print(MESSAGE_START);
00139     Serial.print(message);
00140     Serial.print(checksum);
00141     Serial.print(MESSAGE_END);
00142     response=getByte(50);   //look for the computer's response
00143     
00144     if(response==ACKNOWLEDGE)   //the computer got the data.  It's happy, we're happy, we're done!
00145       success=TRUE;
00146     
00147     else if(response==ACKNOWLEDGE_AND_CONFIGURE)  //the computer can ask to upload a new configuration at any sample
00148     {
00149       success=TRUE;
00150       configure();
00151     }
00152     else         //if there was a timeout or a checksum mismatch, then re-try
00153       tries++;
00154   }
00155     
00156 }
00157 
00159 unsigned char getChecksum()
00160 {
00161   char i=0;
00162   unsigned char checksum=0;
00163   while(message[i]!=0)
00164   {
00165     checksum+=message[i];
00166     i++;
00167   }
00168   return checksum;
00169 }

00172 //nublogger.h
00174 
00183 void configure()
00184 { 
00185   char i=0;
00186   char tries=0;
00187   char success=0;
00188   unsigned char checksum=0;
00189   int error;
00190   
00191   while((tries<NUM_TRIES)&&(success==0))     //we'll try
00192   {
00193   checksum=0;
00194   Serial.print(LISTENING,BYTE);
00195   error=getMessage(100);
00196   if(error==-1)
00197     Serial.print(TIMEOUT_ERROR,BYTE);
00198   else
00199   {
00200     if(buffer[start]==MESSAGE_START)
00201     {
00202       if((index-start)==CONFIGURATION_MESSAGE_LENGTH)    //check to make sure the message is the size we expect
00203       {
00204         for(i=1;i<CHECKSUM;i++)
00205           checksum+=buffer[start+i];
00206         if(checksum==buffer[start+CHECKSUM])    //check to see if the calculated checksum is the same as the received checksum
00207         {
00208           //if it is, then we can load all the sample interval info
00209           hours=(int)buffer[start+HOUR_HIGH]*256+(int)buffer[start+HOUR_LOW];
00210           minutes=(int)buffer[start+MINUTE_HIGH]*256+(int)buffer[start+MINUTE_LOW];
00211           seconds=(int)buffer[start+SECOND_HIGH]*256+(int)buffer[start+SECOND_LOW];
00212           success=1;         //we can stop looping
00213           configured=1;      //the sensor is configured!
00214         }
00215         else
00216         {
00217           if(tries<NUM_TRIES)
00218           {
00219             Serial.print(CHECKSUM_ERROR_PLEASE_RESEND);
00220             tries++;
00221           }
00222           else
00223             Serial.print(CHECKSUM_ERROR_GIVING_UP);
00224         }
00225       }
00226       else      //the message is the wrong size
00227         {
00228           if(tries<NUM_TRIES)
00229           {
00230             Serial.print(MALFORMED_MESSAGE_ERROR_PLEASE_RESEND);
00231             tries++;
00232           }
00233           else
00234             Serial.print(MALFORMED_MESSAGE_ERROR_GIVING_UP);
00235         }
00236     }
00237     else
00238         {
00239           if(tries<NUM_TRIES)
00240           {
00241             Serial.print(MALFORMED_MESSAGE_ERROR_PLEASE_RESEND);
00242             tries++;
00243           }
00244           else
00245             Serial.print(MALFORMED_MESSAGE_ERROR_GIVING_UP);
00246         }
00247   }
00248   }
00249 }

00260 void discover()
00261 { 
00262   unsigned char checksum=0;
00263   int i=0;
00264   Serial.print(MESSAGE_START, BYTE);
00265   Serial.print(DISCOVER_ME,BYTE);
00266   Serial.print(name);
00267   while(name[i]!=0)
00268   {
00269     checksum+=name[i];
00270     i++;
00271   }
00272   checksum+=DISCOVER_ME;
00273   Serial.print(checksum,BYTE);
00274   Serial.print(MESSAGE_END,BYTE);
00275 
00276   int receivedByte=getByte(100);     //looks for a byte on the serial port with a 100ms timeout
00277   if(receivedByte==ACKNOWLEDGE)
00278     discovered=TRUE;
00279   if(receivedByte==ACKNOWLEDGE_AND_CONFIGURE)
00280     {
00281       discovered=TRUE;
00282       configure();
00283     }
00284   if(receivedByte==-1)
00285   {
00286     Serial.print(TIMEOUT_ERROR,BYTE);  //getByte didn't get a byte before the timeout
00287   }  
00288 }

00290 
00292 void waitForSampleInterval()
00293 {
00294   xbeeSleep();
00295   delay(60*minutes*1000+seconds*1000);
00296   xbeeWake();
00297 }

00302 //temperature_sensor_board_v2.h
00321  #define XBEE_SLEEP 2
00322  #define SAMPLE_BUTTON 3
00323  #define LED 4
00324  
00325  #define SENSOR1_TOP 0
00326  #define SENSOR1_BOTTOM 1
00327  #define SENSOR2_TOP 2
00328  #define SENSOR2_BOTTOM 3
00329  
00330  //the NTC thermistor constants.  They have to be floats since #defined constants don't seem to calculate floating point values correctly
00331  float R0=10000.0;
00332  float B=3950.0;
00333  float T0=298;
00334  float RBOTTOM=1000.0;
00335  
00336  
00338 
00343  void initializeSensor()
00344  {
00345    pinMode(XBEE_SLEEP,OUTPUT);
00346    pinMode(SAMPLE_BUTTON,INPUT);
00347    pinMode(LED,OUTPUT);
00348    xbeeWake();
00349  }  
00350  
00351  //just a wrapper for putting the xbee into sleep mode
00352  void xbeeSleep()
00353  {
00354    digitalWrite(XBEE_SLEEP,HIGH);
00355  }
00356  
00357  //just a wrapper for making the xbee wake up
00358  void xbeeWake()
00359  {
00360    digitalWrite(XBEE_SLEEP,LOW);
00361  }
00362  
00363  
00364 void getTemperatures()
00365 {
00366   getRawData();
00367   convertToResistance();
00368   convertToTemperature();
00369 }
00370 
00372 void getRawData()
00373 {
00374   sensor1_top=analogRead(0);
00375   sensor1_bottom=analogRead(1);
00376   
00377 /*  uncomment if I enable 2-sensing elements per sensor
00378   sensor2_top=analogRead(2);
00379   sensor2_bottom=analogRead(3);*/
00380 }
00381 
00383 void convertToResistance()
00384 {
00385     sensor1_resistance = ((float)sensor1_top/(float)sensor1_bottom - 1)*RBOTTOM; // Voltages converted to resistances
00386     /* uncomment if I enable two sensing elements
00387     sensor2_resistance = ((float)sensor2_top/(float)sensor2_bottom - 1)*RBOTTOM; // Voltages converted to resistances*/
00388  
00389 }
00390 
00391 //this function converts the resistance of the thermistor into a temperature according to the thermistor's calibration curve
00392 void convertToTemperature()
00393 {
00394    sensor1_temperature = float(B/log(sensor1_resistance/(R0*exp(-1.0*B/T0))) - 273.0); // Temperature in degrees Celsius
00395    /* uncomment if I enable two sensing elements
00396    sensor2_temperature = float(B/log(sensor2_resistance/(R0*exp(-1.0*B/T0))) - 273.0); // Temperature in degrees Celsius   */
00397 }
